meanings.definition: Undy (verb): to remove dye from fabric
meanings.sent1: She used a special solution to undy the stained shirt.
meanings.sent2: After accidentally spilling bleach on her jeans, she had to undy them.
meanings.sent3: He tried to undy his favorite t-shirt, but ended up turning it a different color instead.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to undy the canvas, revealing a hidden pattern underneath.
meanings.sent5: The laundry detergent claimed to undy clothes without fading the fabric.

meanings.sent1: She preferred undy fabrics for her clothing, as they were more eco-friendly.
meanings.sent2: The undy scarf matched perfectly with her neutral-toned outfit.
meanings.sent3: The undy sweater was a hit at the fashion show, showcasing the beauty of natural colors.
meanings.sent4: His undy hair stood out in a sea of brightly colored hairstyles.
meanings.sent5: The undy cotton had a soft, natural feel against her skin.

meanings.definition: Undy (noun): a fabric that has not been dyed
meanings.sent1: She loved working with undy in her textile designs.
meanings.sent2: The undy on the market was of high quality and perfect for customizing.
meanings.sent3: The undy in the store caught her eye with its pure, natural hue.
meanings.sent4: The undy in her collection added a touch of simplicity and elegance.
meanings.sent5: The undy swatch felt like a blank canvas waiting for creativity to unfold.
